sen.j: 山崎 蒸（烝）（やまざき すすむ、天保4年（1833年）頃？ - 慶応4年1月13日 (旧暦)（1868年2月6日））は、新選組諸士調役兼監察。
sen.e: Susumu YAMAZAKI (around 1833, date of birth unknown - February 6, 1868) was a Shoshi shirabeyaku ken kansatsu of Shinsengumi (Shinsengumi's organizational post for investigating the movement of opponents and keeping the members of Shinsengumi under control).

Susumu YAMAZAKI (around 1833, date of birth unknown - February 6, 1868) was a Shoshi shirabeyaku ken kansatsu of Shinsengumi (Shinsengumi's organizational post for investigating the movement of opponents and keeping the members of Shinsengumi under control).

Susumu YAMAZAKI (around 1833, date of birth unknown - February 6, 1868) was a Shoshi shirabeyaku ken kansatsu of Shinsengumi (Shinsengumi's organizational post for investigating the movement of opponents and keeping the members of Shinsengumi under control).

sen.j: 摂津国大坂出身（山城国出身という説もある）。
sen.e: He hailed from Osaka in Settsu Province (another theory is he hailed from Yamashiro Province).
He hailed from Osaka in Settsu Province (another theory is that he hailed from Yamashiro Province).
sen.cmt: 判りやすくするために"that"を追加しました。
sen.e: He hailed from Osaka in Settsu Province (another theory is that he hailed from Yamashiro Province).

sen.j: 医家または薬種問屋の息子で、京都で隊士の診療を行っていた松本良順より救急法を学んだ。
sen.e: He was the son of a doctor or a drug wholesaler, and he learned first aid from Ryojun MATSUMOTO who was engaged in the treatment of the members of Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He was the son of a doctor or a drug wholesaler, and he learned first aid from Ryojun MATSUMOTO, who was engaged in the treatment of the members of Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: 意味を判りやすくするために、MATUMOTOの後にコンマを追加しました。
sen.e: He was the son of a doctor or a drug wholesaler, and he learned first aid from Ryojun MATSUMOTO, who was engaged in the treatment of the members of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 「我は新撰組の医師なり」と笑いながら言っていたという記録が松本良順の書に残っている。
sen.e: According to a book written by Ryojun MATSUMOTO, he said, while smiling, that "I am a doctor of Shinsengumi".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: According to a book written by Ryojun MATSUMOTO, Yamazaki said, with a smile, that "I am a doctor of Shinsengumi."
sen.cmt: 訳文の"he"が松本を指しているようにも取れるため、"Yamazaki"と明示しました。「笑いながら」を"with a smile"と変更しました。
sen.e: According to a book written by Ryojun MATSUMOTO, Yamazaki said, with a smile, that "I am a doctor of Shinsengumi."

sen.j: 元治元年頃から隊士の動向調査や情報探索の任についている。
sen.e: He started to be engaged in the investigation of the movement of members as well as the information collection from around 1864.
Around 1864, he started to be engaged in investigating the movement of members as well as collecting the information.
sen.cmt: 語順を整理し、2つの動詞"investigate"と"collect"を並列に据える構文に修正しました。
sen.e: Around 1864, he started to be engaged in investigating the movement of members as well as collecting the information.

sen.j: 6月の池田屋事件の時は諸士調役兼監察として島田魁らと長州藩士や尊攘過激派の探索にあたり、見事、尊攘過激派の一人、古高俊太郎宅・枡屋を突き止めている。
sen.e: In connection with the Ikedaya Incident occurred in July, he searched for, along with Kai SHIMADA, the retainers of Choshu domain and radical members of Sonjo-ha (a group advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) and succeeded in locating Masuya, the residence of one of radical member Shuntaro FURUTAKA.

When the Ikedaya Incident occurred in July, he, as a Shoshi shirabeyaku ken kansatsu of Shinsengumi, searched for, along with Kai SHIMADA, the retainers of Choshu domain and radical members of Sonjo-ha (a group advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) and succeeded in locating Masuya, the residence of Shuntaro FURUTAKA, one of the radical members.
sen.cmt: 意味に合わせて、文章をwhenで始まるように変更しました。訳文に「諸士調役兼監察」が見当たりませんでしたので、"as"で挿入しました。（英語訳は上の文章で既に付けていますので、ここではローマ字のみです）。最後の箇所では、同じく意味を取りやすくするため、語順を入れ替えて"Shuntaro FURUTAKA"を先に出してから"one of the radical members"という説明を付けるような形に変更しました。
sen.e: When the Ikedaya Incident occurred in July, he, as a Shoshi shirabeyaku ken kansatsu of Shinsengumi, searched for, along with Kai SHIMADA, the retainers of Choshu domain and radical members of Sonjo-ha (a group advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) and succeeded in locating Masuya, the residence of Shuntaro FURUTAKA, one of the radical members.

sen.j: 枡屋は宮部鼎蔵ら大物志士の密会所となっていた。
sen.e: Masuya was the place where influential activists, including Teizo MIYABE etc., made secret meetings.
Masuya was the place where influential activists, including Teizo MIYABE etc., held secret meetings.
sen.cmt: コロケーションとして、"hold meetings"に変更しました。
sen.e: Masuya was the place where influential activists, including Teizo MIYABE etc., held secret meetings.

sen.j: 宮部の下僕・忠蔵を尾行し枡屋を突き止めたようだ。
sen.e: It seems that he located Masuya by shadowing Miyabe's servant Chuzo.
It seems that he located Masuya by shadowing Miyabe's servant Chuzo.
It seems that he located Masuya by shadowing Miyabe's servant Chuzo.

sen.j: その結果、新選組は尊攘派の御所焼き討ち・天皇長州連れ去りの計画を未然に防ぐ事に成功した。
sen.e: Thanks to the above, Shinsengumi successfully blocked the plan of Sonjo-ha to set fire on the palace and to bring the Emperor to Choshu.
Thanks to the above, Shinsengumi successfully blocked the plans of Sonjo-ha to set fire on the palace and to bring the Emperor to Choshu.
sen.cmt: 複数の計画について述べていますので、"plan"を複数形に変更しました。
sen.e: Thanks to the above, Shinsengumi successfully blocked the plans of Sonjo-ha to set fire on the palace and to bring the Emperor to Choshu.

sen.j: しかし、この武功に対して、各隊士たちが報酬を受けているにも関わらず、山崎の名前が書かれていない。
sen.e: Although the members of Shinsengumi were paid rewards for this achievement, Yamazaki was not included in the list
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although other members of Shinsengumi were given rewards for this achievement, Yamazaki's name was not on the list.
sen.cmt: 新撰組の「他の」メンバーという意味ですので、"other members"と変更しました。金銭的な報酬とは限らない可能性もあるので、"paid rewards"を"given rewards"に変更しました。山崎の「名前」の訳として、"Yamazaki's name"と変更しました。"in the list""on the list"に変更しました。文末にピリオドが抜けていたので補いました。
sen.e: Although other members of Shinsengumi were given rewards for this achievement, Yamazaki's name was not on the list.

sen.j: このため、子母沢寛や司馬遼太郎の創作との説もある。
sen.e: Therefore, some people assert that the above story is a fiction created by Kan SHIMOZAWA and Ryotaro SHIBA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Therefore, some people assert that the above story is a fiction created by Kan SHIMOZAWA and Ryotaro SHIBA.
Therefore, some people assert that the above story is a fiction created by Kan SHIMOZAWA and Ryotaro SHIBA.

sen.j: ただし、報酬を受けている島田魁の日記には探索したメンバーに山崎の名前が入っている。
sen.e: In the diary of Kai SHIMADA who received a reward, however, Yamazaki was listed as a member who searched.
In the diary of Kai SHIMADA who received a reward, however, Yamazaki was listed as a member who went searching.
sen.cmt: "searched"よりも"went searching"の方が自然かと思われましたので変更しました。
sen.e: In the diary of Kai SHIMADA who received a reward, however, Yamazaki was listed as a member who went searching.

sen.j: 香取流の棒術にすぐれていたというが、実際に使用していたものは長巻であるとの説もある。
sen.e: He is said to have been excelled in bojutsu (art of using a stick as a weapon) of Katori school, but some people assert that he actually used nagamaki (long sword).
He is said to have excelled in bojutsu (art of using a stick as a weapon) of Katori school, but some people believe that what he actually used was a nagamaki (a long sword).
sen.cmt: ここではexcelは能動態で使用するべきと思われるため、"been"を削除しました。"assert"はここでの意味としては強すぎると感じましたので、"believe"に変更しました。"that"以下の構文を変更しました。"long sword"に不定冠詞を付け加えました。
sen.e: He is said to have excelled in bojutsu (art of using a stick as a weapon) of Katori school, but some people believe that what he actually used was a nagamaki (a long sword).

sen.j: 大坂についてくわしかったようで、道案内としてたびたび幹部達を大坂にひきつれていったという。
sen.e: It seems that he knew well about Osaka, and he often brought leading members to Osaka as a guide.
It seems that he knew well about Osaka, and he often brought leading members to Osaka as a guide.
It seems that he knew well about Osaka, and he often brought leading members to Osaka as a guide.

sen.j: また、大阪の金持ちの商人の事情にくわしかった。
sen.e: He also knew well about rich merchants in Osaka.
He also knew well about rich merchants in Osaka.
He also knew well about rich merchants in Osaka.

sen.j: 新選組の中では重宝されたようだ。
sen.e: It seems that he was found useful in Shinsengumi.
It seems that he was found useful in Shinsengumi.
It seems that he was found useful in Shinsengumi.

sen.j: その後、禁門の変や第一次長州征討、第二次長州征討などの重要な戦いでも戦況の推移や状況報告に能力を発揮し、近藤勇や会津藩に正確な情報をもたらした。
sen.e: In the subsequent important battles such as the Kinmon Incident, the first conquest of Choshu and the second conquest of Choshu, he showed his ability in collecting information on the progress of a battle and provided accurate information to Isami KONDO and the Aizu domain.

In the subsequent important battles such as the Kinmon Incident, the first conquest of Choshu and the second conquest of Choshu, he showed his ability in collecting information on the progress and situations of a battle and provided accurate information to Isami KONDO and the Aizu domain.
sen.cmt: 「戦況の推移や状況」という原文に合わせて、"situations"を付け加えました。
sen.e: In the subsequent important battles such as the Kinmon Incident, the first conquest of Choshu and the second conquest of Choshu, he showed his ability in collecting information on the progress and situations of a battle and provided accurate information to Isami KONDO and the Aizu domain.

sen.j: 松本良順から医学を学び新選組の医者としても活躍した。
sen.e: He learned medicine from Ryojun MATSUMOTO and worked also as a doctor of Shinsengumi.
He learned medicine from Ryojun MATSUMOTO and worked also as a doctor of Shinsengumi.
He learned medicine from Ryojun MATSUMOTO and worked also as a doctor of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: そのさい、「我は新選組の医者なり」と言って周囲を笑わせる一面もあった。
sen.e: He made his colleagues laugh by saying "I am a doctor of Shinsengumi".
Working as a doctor, he made his colleagues laugh by saying "I am a doctor of Shinsengumi."
sen.cmt: 「そのさい」という原文のニュアンスを出すために、"Working as a doctor"と追加しました。
sen.e: Working as a doctor, he made his colleagues laugh by saying "I am a doctor of Shinsengumi."

sen.j: 慶応4年1月の鳥羽伏見の戦いの最中、重傷を負う。
sen.e: In February 1968, he was seriously wounded in the battle of Toba-Fushimi.
In February 1968, he was seriously wounded in the battle of Toba-Fushimi.
In February 1968, he was seriously wounded in the battle of Toba-Fushimi.

sen.j: 1月13日江戸へ撤退の際、富士山 (軍艦)の船上で高熱により死亡。
sen.e: He died of high fever on February 6th on board a ship Fujisan (warship) while retreating to Edo.
On February 6th, he died from high fever on a ship called Fujisan (warship) while retreating to Edo.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするために、日付を冒頭に移動しました。"died of"を"died from"に変更しました。富士山という名前の船という意味をわかりやすくするために、calledという一語を追加しました。その代わりに、"board"という単語は削除しました。
sen.e: On February 6th, he died from high fever on a ship called Fujisan (warship) while retreating to Edo.

sen.j: 紀州沖で水葬されたとされている。
sen.e: It is believed that he was buried at sea off the coast of Kishu.
It is believed that he was buried at sea off the coast of Kishu.
It is believed that he was buried at sea off the coast of Kishu.

sen.j: その際、近藤勇は涙を流し、土方歳三に「山崎は良い奴だった あいつはァこんなに大勢の人に見送られて幸せだ」ともらしたそうだ。
sen.e: At that time, Isami KONDO shed tears and said to Toshizo HIJIKATA as "Yamazaki was a good person. He is happy with being seen off by so many people".
It is said, at that time, Isami KONDO shed tears and said to Toshizo HIJIKATA, "Yamazaki was a good guy. He is happy with being seen off by so many people."
sen.cmt: 「～そうだ」という意味を入れるために、"It is said"で文を始めるように変更しました。発言の前のasは不要と思われますので削除しました。「奴」というニュアンスを出すために、"person"を"guy"に変更しました。
sen.e: It is said, at that time, Isami KONDO shed tears and said to Toshizo HIJIKATA, "Yamazaki was a good guy. He is happy with being seen off by so many people."

sen.j: その後、船長に深く頭を下げて礼を言っていたそうだ。
sen.e: Thereafter, he deeply bowed and expressed his thanks to the captain.
Thereafter, he is said to deeply bow to the captain and express his thanks.
sen.cmt: 「～そうだ」という意味を入れるために、"he is said to"という文に変更しました。意味を判りやすくするために、"to the captain"を動詞"bow"の直後に移動しました。
sen.e: Thereafter, he is said to deeply bow to the captain and express his thanks.

sen.j: ただ何故か船に同乗していたであろう永倉新八や島田魁らが残した手記にはこの山崎の死や水葬に関して一切触れていない。
sen.e: However, no description concerning Yamazaki's death and water burial is seen in the notes written by Shinpachi NAGAKURA or Kai SHIMADA who were on board the same ship.
However, no description concerning Yamazaki's death and water burial is seen in the notes written by Shinpachi NAGAKURA and Kai SHIMADA who may have been on the same ship.
sen.cmt: 永倉も島田も触れていないということですので、"or"を"and"に変更しました。「同乗していたであろう」という原文ですので、"were"を"may have been"に変更しました。"board"はここでは不要と判断し、削除しました。
sen.e: However, no description concerning Yamazaki's death and water burial is seen in the notes written by Shinpachi NAGAKURA and Kai SHIMADA who may have been on the same ship.

sen.j: 一説には、鳥羽・伏見の戦いで銃で撃たれ死亡したという説もあり、陸上で埋葬された可能性もある。
sen.e: One theory is that he was shot to death in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi and was buried on land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: One theory is that he was shot to death in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi and was buried on land.
One theory is that he was shot to death in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi and was buried on land.

sen.j: このように、その死ははっきりとして定まっておらず謎に包まれている。
sen.e: As seen from the above, there are various views and his death is covered in mystery.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As seen from the above, his death is covered in mystery with various views.
sen.cmt: より簡潔な文章になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: As seen from the above, his death is covered in mystery with various views.

sen.j: 近藤は山崎を信用し、可愛がったようだ。
sen.e: Kondo seems to have trusted and loved Yamazaki.
Kondo seems to have trusted and loved Yamazaki.
Kondo seems to have trusted and loved Yamazaki.

sen.j: 船上での水葬の際、近藤自身も肩の鉄砲傷がひどく寝込んでいたが、別れを告げるべく正装し代表として追悼の言葉を読んだという。
sen.e: At the water burial held on a ship, Kondo dressed up and read his message of condolence though he was shot and wounded in the shoulder.
At the water burial held on the ship, Kondo is said to go out of the bed to be dressed up and read his message of condolences, although he was also shot and heavily wounded in the shoulder.
sen.cmt: shipにつける冠詞を定冠詞に変更しました。「寝込んでいたが」という意味を出すために、"get out of the bed～"と変更しました。「～という」という意味を出すために、"Kondo is said to"と変更しました。condolenceを複数形に変更しました。thoughをコンマ＋althoughに変更しました。「近藤自身も」という意味を出すために、"was also shot"とalsoを追加しました。「傷がひどく」という意味を出すためにheavilyという副詞を追加しました。
sen.e: At the water burial held on the ship, Kondo is said to go out of the bed to be dressed up and read his message of condolences, although he was also shot and heavily wounded in the shoulder.

sen.j: 新選組隊士の山崎林五郎（林新次郎）の従兄弟（義兄弟）で、林五郎の実家の家系図により、妻が居たとの話もあるが、そもそも林五郎と本当に血縁関係があったのかどうかも証明されておらず定かではない。
sen.e: Some people assert that he was a cousin (brother in law) of Ringoro YAMAZAKI (Shinjiro HAYASHI), a member of Shinsengumi, and that he should have a wife based on the family tree of Ringoro's family, but it is not certain whether he had a blood relation with Ringoro.

Some people assert that he was a cousin (brother in law) of Ringoro YAMAZAKI (Shinjiro HAYASHI), a member of Shinsengumi, and that he should have a wife based on the family tree of Ringoro's family, but it is not certain whether he actually had a blood relation with Ringoro in the first place.
sen.cmt: (brother in law)の直前に半角スペースが2つ入っていましたので1つ削除しました。「本当に」の訳として"actually"を、「そもそも」の訳として"in the first place"を追加しました。
sen.e: Some people assert that he was a cousin (brother in law) of Ringoro YAMAZAKI (Shinjiro HAYASHI), a member of Shinsengumi, and that he should have a wife based on the family tree of Ringoro's family, but it is not certain whether he actually had a blood relation with Ringoro in the first place.

sen.j: 子母澤寛の書物では林信太郎の従兄弟とされているが、おそらく林新次郎との混同と思われる。
sen.e: He was deemed as a cousin of Shintaro HAYASI in a book written by Kan SHIMOZAWA, but Shimozawa might have confused with Shinjiro HAYASI.
He was deemed as a cousin of Shintaro HAYASHI in a book written by Kan SHIMOZAWA, but Shimozawa might have been confused with Shinjiro HAYASHI.
sen.cmt: 林の表記を、ヘボン式ローマ字のSHIに変更しました。confusedはここでは受動態が正しいと判断し、"been"を入れました。
sen.e: He was deemed as a cousin of Shintaro HAYASHI in a book written by Kan SHIMOZAWA, but Shimozawa might have been confused with Shinjiro HAYASHI.

sen.j: (山崎蒸水葬説を明治のずっと後になって林信太郎が語ったと記されているが、その頃彼は既に亡くなっていた)
sen.e: (a description is seen in this book that Shintaro Hayashi told about the water burial of Susumu YAMAZAKI in the late Meiji era, but he had already died at that time)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: (There is this description in this book that Shintaro HAYASHI told about the water burial of Susumu YAMAZAKI in the late Meiji era, but the truth is that he had already died at that time.)
sen.cmt: 読んで判りやすくするためにThere is this description in this book that ～, but the truth is that ～ という構文に変更しました。文末にピリオドが抜けていたようですので加えました。
sen.e: (There is this description in this book that Shintaro HAYASHI told about the water burial of Susumu YAMAZAKI in the late Meiji era, but the truth is that he had already died at that time.)

sen.j: また、山崎林五郎と山崎蒸の父の名が同名にすぎず、他人との見解もある。
sen.e: Further, there is a view that although the name of Ringoro YAMAZAKI's father and that of Susumu YAMAZAKI's father were same, they had no blood relations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Further, there is a view that the name of Ringoro YAMAZAKI's father and that of Susumu YAMAZAKI's father were the same, but they were not the same person.
sen.cmt: 血縁関係がある、というよりは他人であるという意味ではないかと思われますので、元の訳文を変更させていただきました。sameにtheを付けました。
sen.e: Further, there is a view that the name of Ringoro YAMAZAKI's father and that of Susumu YAMAZAKI's father were the same, but they were not the same person.

sen.j: 司馬遼太郎の小説『新選組血風録』では赤穂浪士から脱落した奥野将監の子孫として描かれているが、これは創作である。
sen.e: He was depicted as the descendant of Shogen OKUNO, a person who dropped out of Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain), in Ryotaro SHIBA's novel "Shinsengumi Keppuroku", but it is a fiction.
In Ryotaro SHIBA's novel "Shinsengumi Keppuroku," he was depicted as a descendant of Shogen OKUNO, who dropped out of Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain), but it is a fiction.
sen.cmt: 読み下しで判りやすくするために、司馬遼太郎の小説『～』を冒頭に移動しました。descendantは複数名いると思われますので、冠詞を不定冠詞のaに変更しました。"a person who"の"person"を削除しました。
sen.e: In Ryotaro SHIBA's novel "Shinsengumi Keppuroku," he was depicted as a descendant of Shogen OKUNO, who dropped out of Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain), but it is a fiction.

sen.j: 2004年に『山崎烝 取調日記』が見つかった。
sen.e: "Yamazaki Susumu Torishirabe Nikki" was found in 2004.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: A diary named "Yamazaki Susumu Torishirabe Nikki" was found in 2004.
sen.cmt: 日記であることをわかりやすくするために、"A diary named"と付け加えました。
sen.e: A diary named "Yamazaki Susumu Torishirabe Nikki" was found in 2004.

sen.j: 中身は隊士名簿や慶応年間の出来事を書いたメモ帳らしいのだが、詳しくは現在解読中である。
sen.e: It seems to be a kind of memo recording the names of the member of Shinsengumi as well as the events of Keio era, and its decipherment work is currently underway.

sen.e: It seems to be a kind of memos recording the list of the Shinsengumi members as well as the events in Keio era, and its decipherment work is currently under way.
sen.cmt: "memo"を複数形にしました。「隊士名簿」を"the list of the Shinsengumi members"と変更しました。慶応年間の前置詞を"in"に変更しました。"underway"は2語になると思われますので、間にスペースを入れました。
sen.e: It seems to be a kind of memos recording the list of the Shinsengumi members as well as the events in Keio era, and its decipherment work is currently under way.
